author: tersec
content: It's supposed to work in general: https://nimbus.guide/trusted-node-sync.html

author: tersec
content:
A couple relevant caveats:

(1) it's really being targeted/supported as a feature for the next official Nimbus release, while the `kintsugi` branch is sort of randomly between the last release and the upcoming one depending on when it was last rebased, so it's possible that not all the support is there yet; and

(2) I've not tested it at all in a merge context, since, see above, it's not really supported until the next official Nimbus release [and from my perspective, when the kintsugi/kiln branches reach that release]

So it's possible that either there's, yeah, some CORS-related issue, or maybe some other incompatibility.

author: tersec
content: One change that's coming, and that might affect things, not sure, is that right now Nimbus opens a separate websocket connection just for the Engine (CL <-> EL) API calls from the rest of the Eth1 calls, while I'm not sure what other CLs do in that regard.

author: m.kalinin
content: it's supposed to be the same connection as Engine API spec states that `eth_` namespace must also be exposed at the same port as `engine_`
